intro: Anil kuntzei, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. Anil kuntzei is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its leaves are typically gray-green, covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss.
